prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: The latest lawyer to join our agency. She lived in Europe for a time, where she studied psychology.
Character 1
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: The head of our office. He was retired once, but made his return to the legal world a few months ago.
Character 2
Name: Apollo Justice
Description: The lawyer at my agency who was attacked during the court bombing trial. He's currently recovering at the hospital.
Character 3
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: An aspiring magician who Mr. Wright adopted when duty called.
Character 4
Name: Clay Terran
Description: The victim in this case. He was a HAT-2 crew member and a close friend of mine.
Character 5
Name: Juniper Woods
Description: Athena's childhood friend. Talented singer and Student Council President, she is studying to be a judge.
Character 6
Name: Solomon Starbuck
Description: The defendant in this case. He was a HAT-2 crew member and a mentor to the victim.
Character 7
Name: Simon Blackquill
Description: A prosecutor and prison inmate. He can manipulate witnesses through the power of suggestion.
Character 8
Name: Bobby Fulbright
Description: The detective assigned to this case. He led the evacuation effort at the Space Center after the bombing incident.
Character 9
Name: Candice Arme
Description: A detective who specialized in bomb cases. Was on detail at the Space Center. One of the first to find the body.
Character 10
Name: Yuri Cosmos
Description: The director of the Space Center and one of the first people to discover the body. He seems exceedingly full of himself.
Character 11
Name: Ponco
Description: A guide robot at the Space Center. She can provide information on the Center and show people around.
Character 12
Name: Aura Blackquill
Description: A researcher who's developing robots at the Space Center. She is Prosecutor Blackquill's older sister.
Character 13
Name: Clonco
Description: One of the robots developed by Aura, who refers to him as "Hunk of Junk".
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My cherished attorney's badge. Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.* (when playing as Apollo Justice) It's my all-important badge. Proof of my profession.* (when playing as Phoenix Wright)
Evidence 1
Name: Terran's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death: Stabbing. The victim was discovered in the third-floor boarding lounge in the main building.
Evidence 2
Name: Space Center Diagram
Description: A cross-section view of the main building of the Space Center and Launch Pad 1.
Evidence 3
Name: Utility Knife
Description: The victim's blood was found on its blade, but no fingerprints could be lifted. It has the victim's blood on it. From a set of utility tools used by Space Center techs.
Evidence 4
Name: Bombing Report
Description: The explosions sparked a fire on the second floor of the main building and the middle level of the launch pad near the elevator.
Evidence 5
Name: Evacuation Report
Description: The bombs went off despite tight security. Police officers and riot police who had been standing by gave the evacuation instructions.
Evidence 6
Name: Launch Pad 1 Door Lock
Description: A biometric door lock operated by fingerprint recognition. Only the defendant, the victim, and the Space Center director had access. Starbuck's prints were found on this door lock. Also see photo taken after the incident. (2 pages.)
Evidence 7
Name: Security Camera Video
Description: Video showing the defendant and victim's escape from the corridor to the boarding lounge. Video showing the defendant and victim's escape from the corridor. The video ends immediately after this scene.
Evidence 8
Name: Oxygen Tank Data
Description: The victim's tank was ruptured, with 0% left. The defendant's had 80%. Remaining oxygen is displayed on left shoulder. The victim's oxygen tank was struck by a bullet.
Evidence 9
Name: Space Center Pamphlet
Description: A pamphlet for visitors to the Space Center. It includes a diagram of the boarding lounge. It includes a diagram of the boarding lounge and a cross-section view of the Space Center. (3 pages.)
Evidence 10
Name: Bullet Hole
Description: A single bullet hole was found in the boarding lounge. The bullet itself is missing. The only bullet hole found in the boarding lounge. It was made by a bullet fired from a .38-caliber gun.
Evidence 11
Name: Control Room Door Lock
Description: The door lock to the east. It can only be operated by the director. Backup power lets it function even when the power goes out.
Evidence 12
Name: Bullet
Description: Discovered in a gutter that runs along the south wall of the boarding lounge. It was fired from a .10 caliber handgun.
Evidence 13
Name: "Hope" Capsule
Description: Found in the victim's possession. It recently returned from a seven-year mission and contains asteroid samples.
Evidence 14
Name: Aura's Statement
Description: The perp held a lighter with an Earth emblem on it in their left hand, and a knife in their right.
Evidence 15
Name: Bullet from Arme's Gun
Description: The bullet found near the victim's oxygen tank. It was fired from a .38 caliber handgun.
Evidence 16
Name: Lighter
Description: The lighter found on the floor of the Space Museum. The true culprit's fingerprints are on it in the victim's blood. Evidence found by Detective Fulbright. It has Athena's prints on it in the victim's blood.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: All I did was support Clay over my shoulder and get us out of the rocket!
Person: Starbuck
Testimony 1
Testimony: Like always, I took the elevator down to the middle level and headed for the corridor.
Person: Starbuck
Testimony 2
Testimony: Clay had passed out by the time we got the order to evacuate.
Person: Starbuck
Testimony 3
Testimony: I didn't kill Clay! I was trying to save him!
Person: Starbuck

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem. So, the task is to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user wants one pair, and I need to make sure I pick the correct one based on the given characters, evidence, and testimonies.

First, I should review all the testimonies provided by Starbuck. He's the defendant, so his statements might have inconsistencies. Let me look at each of his testimonies:

Testimony 0: "All I did was support Clay over my shoulder and get us out of the rocket!"
Testimony 1: "Like always, I took the elevator down to the middle level and headed for the corridor."
Testimony 2: "Clay had passed out by the time we got the order to evacuate."
Testimony 3: "I didn't kill Clay! I was trying to save him!"

Now, I need to check each testimony against the evidences to find contradictions. Let's go through each testimony one by one.

Starting with Testimony 0: Starbuck claims he supported Clay and got them out of the rocket. The evidence related to their movement might be the Security Camera Video (Evidence 7), which shows them escaping to the boarding lounge. But I don't see a direct contradiction here. The video ends after that scene, which might not conflict with his statement.

Testimony 1: He took the elevator to the middle level. The Bombing Report (Evidence 4) mentions explosions on the middle level of the launch pad near the elevator. If the elevator was damaged or the area was on fire, maybe using the elevator would be impossible. But the Launch Pad 1 Door Lock (Evidence 6) has his prints, so he did access that area. Not sure yet.

Testimony 2: Clay passed out when they got the evacuation order. The Oxygen Tank Data (Evidence 8) shows Clay's tank had 0% left and was ruptured by a bullet. If Clay was already unconscious, how did his oxygen tank get ruptured by a bullet? Maybe the bullet was fired after he passed out, but if they were evacuating, perhaps during the chaos. Hmm.

Testimony 3: Starbuck claims he was trying to save Clay, not kill him. The key here is to find evidence that shows he could have done the killing. The Utility Knife (Evidence 3) has the victim's blood but no fingerprints. If Starbuck used the knife, but there are no prints, maybe he wore gloves. Not directly contradicting his testimony. Wait, maybe another angle.

Looking at Aura's Statement (Evidence 14): The perp had a lighter with an Earth emblem in left hand and a knife in right. The Lighter (Evidence 16) has Athena's prints in blood, but Starbuck's involvement? If Starbuck says he was saving him, but the evidence shows the killer used a knife and lighter, maybe his testimony conflicts with that. But the Lighter has Athena's prints, not Starbuck's. Hmm.

Wait, the Bullet Hole (Evidence 10) is from a .38-caliber gun, and the Bullet from Arme's Gun (Evidence 15) is a .38 caliber. Also, the Bullet (Evidence 12) is a .10 caliber found in the gutter. So there are two bullets: one .38 (from Arme's gun) and one .10. The Oxygen Tank was hit by the .38 bullet (Evidence 8 and 15). So maybe the .10 bullet is from another gun. 

But how does this relate to Starbuck's testimony? Let's think again. If Starbuck claims he was trying to save Clay, but evidence shows that the oxygen tank was shot, leading to Clay's death. If Clay was already unconscious (Testimony 2), then the shooting of the oxygen tank might have happened after he passed out. But who shot it? If the bullet from Arme's gun (Evidence 15) is involved, maybe Detective Arme's actions caused the tank to rupture. But how does that tie to Starbuck?

Wait, Starbuck's Testimony 3 says he didn't kill Clay, he was saving him. But the autopsy says death by stabbing (Evidence 1). The Utility Knife (Evidence 3) has the victim's blood, but no prints. So if the cause of death is stabbing, then the killer used the knife. Starbuck says he didn't kill him, but if he had the knife, maybe that's the contradiction. But the knife's fingerprints are absent. So maybe the contradiction is elsewhere.

Looking at Testimony 1: Starbuck says he took the elevator down to the middle level. The Bombing Report (Evidence 4) says the explosion was on the middle level near the elevator. If the elevator was damaged by the explosion, could he have used it? Or maybe the Control Room Door Lock (Evidence 11) is only operable by the director, but that's a different area. Hmm.

Another angle: the Security Camera Video (Evidence 7) shows Starbuck and the victim escaping to the boarding lounge, and the video ends there. The Bullet Hole (Evidence 10) is in the boarding lounge, from a .38. The Oxygen Tank was ruptured by that bullet. So if the video ends right after they enter the lounge, then the shooting happened there. But Starbuck's Testimony 0 says he was supporting Clay out of the rocket, but the video shows them in the corridor leading to the boarding lounge. Maybe the rocket is elsewhere. Not sure.

Wait, maybe the key contradiction is in Testimony 2 where Starbuck says Clay was passed out during evacuation, but the oxygen tank was ruptured by a bullet. If Clay was already unconscious, then the bullet hitting the tank would cause him to lose oxygen, leading to death. But the autopsy says cause of death is stabbing. So maybe the stabbing happened after the oxygen was depleted. But how does that relate to Starbuck's testimony?

Alternatively, maybe the Security Camera Video (Evidence 7) shows Starbuck and Clay moving to the boarding lounge, but if the video ends immediately, perhaps Starbuck had the opportunity to stab Clay after that. But if Starbuck claims he was trying to save him (Testimony 3), but the knife with his victim's blood is found, but no fingerprints. Since the knife is from Space Center techs, maybe Starbuck had access. But no fingerprints, so maybe he wore gloves.

Wait, the Lighter (Evidence 16) has Athena's prints, which might be a red herring, but the problem is to find a contradiction between Starbuck's testimony and evidence.

Let me think again. The key is to find a testimony from Starbuck that directly contradicts a piece of evidence.

Looking at Testimony 2: "Clay had passed out by the time we got the order to evacuate." If Clay was passed out, then how was he stabbed? The stabbing would have to occur after he passed out. But if Starbuck was carrying him (Testimony 0), then Starbuck would have been in a position to stab him. But he claims he didn't kill him (Testimony 3). The autopsy says stabbing is the cause of death, so if Clay was already unconscious when evacuated, the stabbing must have happened during or after evacuation. If Starbuck was with him, then maybe his testimony that he was trying to save him conflicts with the stabbing.

But the Utility Knife (Evidence 3) has the victim's blood but no fingerprints. If Starbuck used the knife, he would have left prints unless wearing gloves. However, the Launch Pad 1 Door Lock (Evidence 6) has Starbuck's fingerprints. So he wasn't wearing gloves when using the door, but the knife has no prints. That could suggest someone else used the knife, but how does that contradict his testimony?

Alternatively, the Security Camera Video (Evidence 7) shows them escaping to the boarding lounge, but the video ends. The stabbing would have to happen in the lounge. If the video shows them entering but not the stabbing, maybe the timing is off. However, the contradiction might be elsewhere.

Wait, another angle: Testimony 1 says Starbuck took the elevator down to the middle level. The Bombing Report (Evidence 4) states the explosion was on the middle level near the elevator. If the elevator was damaged in the explosion, how could he have used it? But maybe the explosion happened after he used the elevator. The timing is important here. If the evacuation order came after the bombing, maybe he couldn't have taken the elevator if it was already damaged. But the evidence doesn't specify the timeline clearly.

Alternatively, the Oxygen Tank Data (Evidence 8) shows the victim's tank was ruptured by a bullet from a .38 (Evidence 15). If Starbuck was with Clay, and the tank was ruptured by a bullet, then perhaps someone shot the tank, causing Clay to lose oxygen. But the cause of death is stabbing, not suffocation. So maybe the stabbing occurred after the tank was ruptured. But how does this relate to Starbuck's testimony?

Wait, Testimony 3: "I didn't kill Clay! I was trying to save him!" But the cause of death is a stabbing with the utility knife. If the knife is the murder weapon and Starbuck had access to it (since it's from Space Center techs), and he was the one with Clay, then his claim of saving him contradicts the evidence that the knife with Clay's blood was used, implying he might have stabbed him. However, since there are no fingerprints on the knife, it's not directly implicating him. But maybe another piece of evidence contradicts his statement.

Looking at the Lighter (Evidence 16), which has Athena's prints. But that's separate from Starbuck. Let me check Aura's Statement (Evidence 14): the perp had a lighter in left hand and knife in right. The lighter found has Athena's prints. But Starbuck's testimony says he didn't do it. If the perp is supposed to have the lighter and knife, and the lighter has Athena's prints, maybe she's involved. But the question is about Starbuck's testimony conflicting with evidence.

Hmm. Maybe the contradiction is between Testimony 0 and the Security Camera Video. Testimony 0 says he supported Clay over his shoulder and got them out of the rocket. But the Security Camera Video (Evidence 7) shows them escaping from the corridor to the boarding lounge, not the rocket. Wait, maybe the rocket is in a different location. If the video shows them in the corridor leading to the boarding lounge, but Starbuck says he got them out of the rocket, then there's a discrepancy. But the rocket's location isn't clear from the evidence. The Space Center Diagram (Evidence 2) might show the layout. If the rocket is in the launch pad, and the boarding lounge is in the main building, then escaping the rocket would mean moving to the launch pad, but the video shows them in the main building's corridor. That could be a contradiction. But I need to check the evidence details.

Evidence 2: Space Center Diagram is a cross-section of the main building and Launch Pad 1. Evidence 9: Pamphlet includes a diagram of the boarding lounge and cross-section. So maybe the rocket is on the launch pad, and the boarding lounge is in the main building. If Starbuck says they got out of the rocket (Testimony 0), but the video shows them in the corridor of the main building, that could mean they were not in the rocket when escaping. Therefore, Testimony 0 is contradicted by Evidence 7 (Security Camera Video) which shows them in the corridor, not the rocket. But the testimony says they got out of the rocket, implying they were in the rocket initially. The video shows their escape in the corridor, which might be after exiting the rocket. So maybe that's not a contradiction.

Alternatively, Testimony 1: Starbuck says he took the elevator down to the middle level. The Control Room Door Lock (Evidence 11) can only be operated by the director. If the middle level's elevator was near the Control Room, which requires the director's access, but Starbuck used the elevator, that could be a contradiction if he shouldn't have access. But the Launch Pad 1 Door Lock (Evidence 6) says only defendant, victim, and director had access. The elevator might be a different area. Not sure.

Wait, another angle. The Oxygen Tank Data (Evidence 8) shows the defendant's tank had 80% left. If Starbuck was with Clay and trying to save him, why does his tank still have 80%? If Clay's tank was ruptured, maybe Starbuck didn't share his oxygen, which might contradict his claim of trying to save him. But that's speculative.

The key contradiction I recall from the game (if this is based on a real case) is that Starbuck's fingerprints were on the Launch Pad 1 Door Lock (Evidence 6), which only he, the victim, and the director had access to. But his testimony about his movements might conflict with that. Wait, no. The testimony about taking the elevator might not directly contradict. 

Wait, Testimony 1: "Like always, I took the elevator down to the middle level and headed for the corridor." The Bombing Report (Evidence 4) says the explosion was on the middle level near the elevator. If the elevator was rendered unusable due to the explosion, then Starbuck couldn't have taken it. Therefore, his Testimony 1 about using the elevator contradicts the fact that the elevator area was damaged by the bomb. But the timing is important—did the bombing happen before or after he used the elevator? The Evacuation Report (Evidence 5) says the bombs went off despite tight security, leading to evacuation. So maybe the bombs went off first, then evacuation. If Starbuck used the elevator after the bombing, which damaged the elevator, that's impossible. Therefore, Testimony 1 contradicts Evidence 4 (Bombing Report) about the elevator being damaged.

Alternatively, the Security Camera Video (Evidence 7) shows them escaping through the corridor to the boarding lounge, which might be on a different floor. If the elevator was on the middle level, but they were seen in the corridor leading to the boarding lounge (third floor, per Autopsy Report Evidence 1), then maybe the elevator usage is conflicting. For example, if the boarding lounge is on the third floor, and he took the elevator down to the middle level (Testimony 1), but the video shows them on the third floor, that's a contradiction. Because if he took the elevator down to the middle level, they should be there, but the video shows them in the corridor leading to the third-floor boarding lounge. So that's a contradiction between Testimony 1 (middle level) and the video (third floor).

Yes, that makes sense. The Autopsy Report (Evidence 1) states the victim was found on the third-floor boarding lounge. The Security Camera Video (Evidence 7) shows them escaping to the boarding lounge (third floor). But Testimony 1 says Starbuck took the elevator down to the middle level. If the middle level is different from the third floor, then his statement about being on the middle level contradicts the video showing him on the third floor. Therefore, Evidence 7 (Security Camera Video) contradicts Testimony 1 (Starbuck's elevator use to middle level).

Characters:

cot:
Okay, let's see. The task is to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. So I need to go through each testimony and check if any of the evidences directly contradict it.

Looking at the testimonies first. The three testimonies are all from Starbuck (Character 6). 

Testimony 0: He says his escape route was a mistake in what he said before. So maybe he changed his story here.

Testimony 1: He now says he took a different route, maybe or probably. So he's unsure or changing his story again.

Testimony 2: He claims he went down from the upper level with the capsule and Clay. So his movement is from upper level down.

Now, looking at the evidences. Let's check each one.

Evidence 6 is the Launch Pad 1 Door Lock. It says Starbuck's prints were found on the door lock. But the door lock is a biometric one, which only the defendant (Starbuck), victim (Clay), and director (Yuri) had access to. So if Starbuck's prints are there, maybe that's part of the access, but how does that contradict his testimony?

Evidence 7 is the Security Camera Video. It shows Starbuck and the victim escaping from the corridor to the boarding lounge, and the video ends after that. So if Starbuck's testimony 2 says he went down from the upper level, but the video shows him in the corridor leading to the boarding lounge, maybe the boarding lounge is on a different level. Wait, the Space Center Diagram (Evidence 2) might show the layout. Let me check.

Evidence 2 is a cross-section view of the main building and Launch Pad 1. The boarding lounge is on the third floor (from Evidence 1: victim found there). If the security camera video shows them moving to the third-floor boarding lounge, but Starbuck's testimony 2 says he came down from the upper level, that could be a contradiction. Because if the upper level is above the boarding lounge, then going down would mean to the boarding lounge. Wait, maybe the boarding lounge is on the third floor, and the upper level is higher. So if he went down from the upper level (like fourth floor?) to the third floor boarding lounge, then the video would show him moving to the boarding lounge. That might align. Hmm, maybe not a contradiction here.

Wait, Testimony 2 says he made his way down from the upper level with the capsule and Clay. If the capsule was found in the victim's possession (Evidence 13: "Hope" Capsule), and the victim was found in the third-floor boarding lounge, then Starbuck bringing him down there would make sense. But how does the video fit in? The video shows them escaping to the boarding lounge. So if the video ends after that scene, maybe the problem is that he later claims to have gone down from the upper level, but the video shows them already there. Not sure yet.

Evidence 12 is the Bullet found in the gutter, which is from a .10 caliber, but the Bullet Hole (Evidence 10) is from a .38. So different guns involved. Maybe not directly related to Starbuck's testimony.

Evidence 14 is Aura's statement: perp had a lighter with Earth emblem in left hand, knife in right. Evidence 16 is the Lighter with Athena's prints. So if Starbuck is the defendant, but the lighter has Athena's prints, maybe someone else was involved. But how does this relate to the testimonies?

Back to the testimonies. Let's focus on Testimony 2 again: "With the capsule and Clay in my arms, I made my way down from the upper level." If he's coming down from the upper level to the boarding lounge (third floor), then perhaps the security camera video (Evidence 7) would show that movement. But the video shows them escaping to the boarding lounge. If the upper level is part of their escape route, then maybe the video contradicts his statement about the route. Wait, the Security Camera Video's description says it shows the defendant and victim's escape from the corridor to the boarding lounge. The video ends immediately after. So if Starbuck's testimony says he went down from the upper level, but the video shows them moving from the corridor to the boarding lounge, perhaps the corridor isn't the upper level. Maybe the corridor is on the same level as the boarding lounge, meaning he didn't come down from an upper level. That would create a contradiction between Testimony 2 and Evidence 7. Because if they were already on the same level as the boarding lounge (third floor), then saying he came down from the upper level would be a lie. Alternatively, maybe the upper level is the fourth floor, and the video shows them moving from the fourth floor corridor to the third floor boarding lounge. Then the video would support his testimony. Hmm, maybe the diagram (Evidence 2) can clarify.

Looking at Evidence 2: Space Center Diagram. The main building has a third-floor boarding lounge. If the corridor is on the same third floor, then moving from corridor to the lounge wouldn't involve going down. But if the corridor is on a higher floor, then moving down to the lounge would make sense. The Security Camera Video's description isn't explicit about the floor levels. However, the Evacuation Report (Evidence 5) mentions bombs on the second floor and launch pad middle level. The Autopsy (Evidence 1) says victim was found on third floor. So if Starbuck's testimony says he came down from upper level (maybe fourth floor?), but the video shows them moving through a corridor to the third floor boarding lounge, then there's a contradiction if the corridor is on the third floor. Alternatively, if the corridor is on the fourth floor, then moving to the third floor would align. But without the diagram's exact details, maybe the key contradiction is between the video and his testimony about the route.

Alternatively, looking at Evidence 6: Launch Pad 1 Door Lock. Starbuck's prints were found there. The door lock can only be accessed by him, the victim, and the director. If his testimony claims he took a different route, maybe the door lock's presence contradicts his stated route. For example, if his original testimony said he used the door, but now he's changing his story to say he took a different route, then Evidence 6 (his prints on the door) would contradict Testimony 1 where he says he took a different route. Testimony 1 says he probably took a different route. If the door lock's biometrics require his fingerprint, then using the door would leave his prints. So if he's now saying he didn't go through the door (took a different route), but his prints are on the door lock, that's a contradiction. So Evidence 6 (Launch Pad Door Lock with his prints) contradicts Testimony 1 where he claims a different route. That seems like a possible pair.

Alternatively, Testimony 0: He says his previous statement about escape route was a mistake. Testimony 1: He now says he took a different route. If the door lock's evidence (Evidence 6) shows he used the door, then his new testimony about a different route contradicts the evidence. So Evidence 6 and Testimony 1 would be the contradiction. 

Yes, that makes sense. Because if the door lock (Evidence 6) has his fingerprints, that means he used that door. But in Testimony 1, he's saying he took a different route. Therefore, using the door would be part of his original route, and changing his testimony to a different route would contradict the evidence of his prints on the door. So the contradiction is between Evidence 6 and Testimony 1.
